explanation: Agent A is correct. In MHD_lookup_connection_value_n the local variable pos is only used for read-only access (iterated, inspected fields header/header_size/value/value_size/kind) and never used to modify the pointed-to header structure. Per MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 the pointer should be const-qualified when possible. It is safe to change the declaration to: const struct MHD_HTTP_Req_Header *pos; assigning pos = pos->next is permitted (a non-const pointer-to-object can be assigned to a pointer-to-const), and all subsequent uses only read members. Therefore the report that this fragment violates Rule 8.13 is correct.
